Name: Kandy Hall
Description:
Kandy's body was found in a field in northeast Baltimore suffering from massive trauma and stab wounds to her body. Paramedics pronounced her dead on the scene.

> Early Tuesday morning, Baltimore police discovered the body of a transgender woman in a field in Northeast Baltimore. Earlier today, police identified the body as that of 40-year-old Kandy Hall.
>
> Hall lived on the 4000 block of Raymonn Street, and is believed to have been the victim of a homicide, suffering from massive trauma to her body. Paramedics pronounced her dead on the scene.
>
An autopsy will be performed to determine her official cause of death.
>
> Hall is believed to have been murdered the same day Baltimore Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake and Police Commissioner Anthony W. Batts hosted a forum for Northeastern Baltimore residents on the topic of public safety.

TvT project: Baltimore Sun, 04.06.2014 & The Advocate 04.06.2014

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/transgender-womans-murder-has-community-on-edge-in-baltimore/

https://www.washingtonblade.com/2014/06/08/murdered-transgender-woman-fun-loving-caring-person/

Name: Paola
Description:
Paola's body was found on the edges of a coffee plantation on the afternoon of Sunday 8th June. Her hands and feet were tied, her genitals exposed and she had multiple stab wounds.

> The body of a 29-year-old [trans woman] was found this Sunday afternoon (08) in the Arandu region, 281 km from the greater São Paulo. According to information from the Military Police, a resident of the countryside was the one who found the body on the margins of a coffee plantation. The body was found with feet and hands tied. Forensics were on site and found several bruises on the victim's body and deep cuts, possibly caused by a knife. According to the police, the victim lived in Avaré (15 km from where the body was found) and made a stop on the Salim Curiati highway at the time of SP 245. The police suspect that a client of the victim may have been the perpetrator of the crime. So far, no one has been arrested.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Jornal do Estado 09.06.2014

Name: Mia Henderson
Description:
Mia was killed after she refused a man who offered her $10 for a date. Before she was killed they were seen walking down an alley together by a witness.

In August 2015 Shawn Oliver was charged with her murder.

> BALTIMORE (WJZ) — The Baltimore Police Department have charged a man in the 2014 murder of a transgender woman.
>
> On July 16, 2014, Mia Henderson, whose legal name is [deadname], was brutally murdered on the 3400 Piedmont Avenue.
>
> Her death was one of two murders that rocked the LGBT community. A month earlier, Kandy Hall was found stabbed to death in June of 2014. Her killer remains at large.
>
> On Thursday, police announced charges against Shawn Oliver for killing Mia Henderson. Police said during the attack, Mia fought her attacker which eventually led to the discovery of DNA evidence under Mia’s fingernails.

Mia was the sibling of the NBA Detroit Pistons' star Reggie Bullock. In the aftermath of Mia's murder he became a vocal advocate for LGBTQ+ people:

> Bullock has been an avid advocate for the LGBTQ+ community throughout his NBA career, which started right after the murder of his sister Mia Henderson in 2014. Henderson was transgender, and Bullock said her killing was “something that hit home for me and my family.”
>
> “It definitely had me use my platform to stand up and do what’s right for her and my family,” Bullock talked with Ernie Johnson on the TNT broadcast prior to Game 3. “I got linked with all the right organizations and everything around to help me her name back to light and shed light on others to stop crazy things like this from happening in the world.

TvT project: WCTI  12, 24.07.2014 & The Advocate  16.06.2014

https://thesportsrush.com/nba-news-my-sister-was-murdered-just-using-my-platform-to-bring-her-name-back-to-life-mavs-forward-reggie-bullock-tells-why-he-supports-the-lgbtq-community-after-losing-a-transgender-sibling/

She was 26. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: A. P. Silva
Description:
A. was stabbed by a client in an apartment in the Boa Viagem neighborhood after he refused to pay for her services.

The owner of the apartment Ulisses Junior de Lima was arrested.x

> The mechanic Ulisses Junior de Lima was arrested in the strife last Monday night for murdering a transvestite in the Boa Viagem neighborhood of Recife, Pernambuco. According to delegate Paulo Furtado of the 3rd Homicide and Personal Protection Department (DHPP), the victim was approached by Ulisses for a program and taken to the mechanic's bride's apartment.
> 
> Upon arriving there, Ulisses would have noticed that the escort was a trans woman and refused to pay the program. The two went into physical fighting and the victim was struck at the neck with a knife. Then Ulisses dragged his body up the stairs from the eighth floor to the garage of the building, where he placed it in a plastic bag and drove to Ipojuca, about 50 km away from the Boa Viagem neighborhood, where he set fire.
> 
> "The neighbors said they heard some confusion, screams, saw blood on the stairs and distrusted. We went to the scene to investigate the complaint, and when he returned, he confessed to the crime and was arrested in the act. He will be charged with qualified murder and corpse concealment, "Furtado said.
> 
> There is still no confirmation on the social name of the victim.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Jornal do Comercio 16.06.2014

Name: Shayara
Description:
Shayara was found beaten to death with a stick on a hill in Rio de Janeiro in the morning. A news magazine reported that she provided sexual services to a policeman the night before.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Rede Record R7  18.06.2014

Name: Yaz’min Shancez
Description:
Yaz'min was shot, set on fire and her body dumped behind a garbage bin. In November 2016, Terry Brady was sentenced to life for her murder.

> A transgender Florida woman’s family can now feel justice was doled out after the man convicted of killing her was sentenced to life in prison.
> 
> On Monday, Lee County Circuit Judge Frank Porter sentenced 47-year-old Terry Brady, of Fort Myers, Fla., to life in prison for shooting 31-year-old Yaz’min Shancez at least six times and then setting her body on fire before trying to dispose of her remains. Porter also denied an appeal by Brady’s lawyers seeking to overturn the second-degree murder conviction that a jury handed down in September, reports the Fort Myers News-Press.

TvT project: Naples Daily News 20.06.2014 & The Advocate 22.06.2014

Name: Tiffany Edwards
Description:
Tiffany was shot by a man who had offered her a ride and then argued with her. Police later apprehended Quamar Edwards and he made a full confession to the murder.

> Last Thursday, Tiffany Edwards — a 28-year-old transgender woman of color — was found shot to death in Walnut Hills, Ohio, a suburb of Cincinnati. Edwards’ death marks the fourth trans woman of color murdered this month, and the fourth trans woman murdered in Ohio since January 2013.
>
> According to Monica Roberts at TransGriot, Cincinnati Police are in search of Quamar Edwards, a suspect in Tiffany Edwards’ murder. The suspect is 5’10”, weighs 250 pounds, and has a last known address on the 1000 Block of Winfield Ave. in Cincinnati.

TvT project: Pink News 28.06.2014 & Outlook Ohio Magazine 27.06.2014 & The Advocate 30.06.2014
